entry.title: Bitcoin Price Outlook for July
entry.summary:
Two weeks into July and bitcoin has risen to a fourteen-month high, as cryptocurrency markets reacted to the Ripple Labsâ€™ ruling. XRP was partially ruled to not be a security by U.S. judge Analisa Torres, after a lawsuit from the Security and Exchange Commission (SEC). However, what does this mean for price action for the remainder of the month?
Current Market Status
Prior to Thursday, cryptocurrency markets mostly consolidated to start the month, as traders digested various data points from the United States.
Firstly, non-farm payrolls fell below expectations, coming in at 205,000, then inflation also slipped, dropping to a two-year low of 3.0%.
Despite this, traders still struggled to define market sentiment, with BTC unable to break out of a ceiling at $31,000, until this week.
July Outlook
Bitcoin (BTC) surged to an intraday peak of $31,862 on Thursday, which was its strongest level since May 2022.
The move came following a breakout of a resistance level at $31,400, however, bulls have so far been unable to sustain this.
As of writing this, BTC is trading at $30,342.71, after briefly falling below $30,000 during Saturdayâ€™s session.
Looking at the chart, the price has since stabilized, as the relative strength index (RSI) of 14 weeks, fell to a floor at 61.00.
Should this floor hold, bitcoin bulls will likely continue to target a breakout above the next key ceiling, which lay at $32,400.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Where will bitcoin end the month? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Biggest Movers: SHIB up 7% on Saturday, as DOGE Moves to 2-Month Peak
entry.summary:
Shiba inu was one of Saturdayâ€™s biggest movers, as the meme coin rose by as much as 7% to start the weekend. The global crypto market cap was mostly lower, falling by over 2% as traders began to secure recent gains. Despite this, dogecoin also rose, hitting a two-month high in todayâ€™s session.
Shiba Inu (SHIB)
Shiba Inu (SHIB) rose by as much as 7% to start the weekend, despite the wider cryptocurrency market mostly moving lower.
SHIB/USD climbed to an intraday peak of $0.000008484 on Saturday, a day after trading at a low of $0.000007705.
As a result of todayâ€™s high, the meme coin rose to its strongest point since June 5, when the price was trading at $0.00000867.
The move took place as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) broke out of a ceiling at the 62.00 mark.
At the time of writing this, the index is now at 64.00, with an upcoming resistance point of 68.00 a possible destination for bulls.
There is a good chance that SHIB will be trading at $0.00000900, in the event the bulls reach their target.
Dogecoin (DOGE)
Another notable gainer to start the weekend was dogecoin (DOGE), which also cemented a multi-month high.
Following a low of $0.0672 on Friday, DOGE/USD jumped 5% higher on Saturday, hitting a peak of $0.07471 in the process.
This resulted in the meme coin trading at its highest level since May 8, which is the last time price was above $0.0770.
Earlier gains have somewhat faded, as traders leave earlier positions, as a result of the RSI colliding with a ceiling at 66.00.
The meme coin is now trading at $0.07351, however overall sentiment for the weekend could remain bullish, should it move past the 66.00 point.

entry.title: Moral Compass: The Political Spectrum And Our Understandings Of Bitcoin
entry.summary: This is an opinion editorial by Dea Rezkitha, an Indonesian Bitcoin educator and podcast host. In politics, individuals are often grouped into â€œleftâ€ and â€œrightâ€ wings, but the complexities go well beyond this simple dichotomy. To gain a deeper understanding of peopleâ€™s beliefs and values, and ultimately how these will inform their outlook on Bitcoin, it is crucial to consider their social views as well. This is where a political compass comes into play, serving as a valuable tool for analysis. What Is A Political Compass? The political compass is a graphical representation of political ideologies that helps categorize individuals or groups based on their views on two main axes: economic policy (left-right) and social policy (authoritarian-libertarian). It provides a more nuanced understanâ€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: Bitcoin Retreats From 14-Month High, as Profit Takers Swoop In
entry.summary:
Bitcoin plunged from a recent fourteen-month high to start the weekend, as traders appeared to have begun securing yesterdayâ€™s gains. The decline saw the price fall below $30,000, days after almost moving above $32,000. Ethereum also slipped, however remained above $1,900.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) fell below $30,000 to start the weekend, as traders began to take profits, following recent highs.
After peaking at $31,354.48 on Saturday, BTC/USD plunged to an intraday low of $29,966.39 earlier today.
This sees bitcoin retreat from a high of $31,862, which was the strongest level for the cryptocurrency since last May.
Looking at the chart, the decline was somewhat inevitable, due to the relative strength (RSI) moving into overbought territory.
The index rose to a peak of 65.55 on Thursday, before falling to a current reading of 54.17 earlier today.
Since this drop, price strength has since stabilized, with BTC now trading at $30,347.59.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) also moved lower on Saturday, however traders were able to reject a drop below the $1,900 level.
ETH/USD slipped to a bottom of $1,901.36 earlier in the day, less than 24-hours after trading at a top of $2,005.96.
Since hitting Fridayâ€™s three-month high, bulls have opted to abandon previous positions heading into the weekend.
The worldâ€™s second largest cryptocurrency has since rebounded, bouncing away from a floor at $1,900, and now trades at $1,943.27.
This comes as the RSI held firm at a support point around the 55.00 zone, going on to climb to a current reading of 56.79.
Overall, the next target could be around the 61.00 mark, and if successfully hit, ETH will likely be back over $2,000.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Will markets consolidate during this weekend? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.title: Bitcoin Not A Security, NYC Mayor Maintains, Following Disclosure Backlash
entry.summary:
Bitcoin has become an integral part of New York City Mayor Eric Adamsâ€™ financial strategy, as he boldly embraced the cryptocurrency and positioned the city as a thriving hub for the industry.
However, an unfortunate oversight occurred when Adams mistakenly failed to disclose a certain aspect of his involvement with Bitcoin, a misstep that stemmed from his belief that it did not qualify as a security, according to his team.
Renowned for his outspoken support of Bitcoin, Adams, who previously served as a police officer, wholeheartedly advocates for the widespread adoption of the cryptocurrency.Â
In a bold move, he even opted to receive a portion of his salaries in Bitcoin, favoring the decentralized digital currency over traditional fiat currencies.
Bitcoin: A Currency, Not a Securâ€¦

entry.title: Kim Dotcom-Backed Crypto Startup Bitcache Liquidated in New Zealand
entry.summary:
Bitcache, a crypto startup backed by Kim Dotcom, has been liquidated, reportedly over unpaid legal fees. Phil Creagh, an Auckland lawyer who acted as Bitcacheâ€™s director until Sept. 2020, is reported to have applied for the startupâ€™s liquidation on May 24.
Bitcacheâ€™s Unpaid Legal Fees
A New Zealand-based crypto startup previously promoted by prominent crypto advocate and entrepreneur Kim Dotcom, has been reportedly liquidated over unpaid legal fees. According to a report by Newsroom, owners of the startup known as Bitcache have not contested the decision to liquidate.
The liquidation of the startup, which Kim Dotcom lauded as a platform that would revolutionize the way online content creators get paid, came more than six years after it was launched. Phil Creagh, an Auckland lawyer who acted as Bitcacheâ€™s director until Sept. 2020, is reported to have applied for the startupâ€™s liquidation on May 24.
Commenting on the decision to liquidate Bitcache before it achieved any of its objectives, Creagh said:
Itâ€™s pretty straightforward, there are fees owed and not paid. The company has not taken any steps so far to avoid being placed in liquidation. Weâ€™ll put it in liquidation and see what, if anything, can be recovered.
The lawyer added that his firm Anderson Creagh Lai stopped representing the Kim Dotcom-backed startup some time ago.
According to the Newsroom report, Bitcache initially hit a major obstacle in early 2017 when the platformâ€™s planned launch was interrupted by what Dotcom referred to as a â€œhiccup.â€ Since then, attempts to launch the platform have all failed. The report added that Bitcache, which reportedly last filed a return to the Companies Office in 2021, is now likely to be removed from the Companies Register.
What are your thoughts on this story? Let us know what you think in the comments section below.

Iâ€™ve reviewed the district court ruling on XRP and it rests on very shaky ground. Expect an appeal.

entry.title: Arbitrum Could Be The Best Layer-2 Play In The Bull Market, Hereâ€™s Why
entry.summary:
Arbitrum is one of the many Layer-2 rollups in the space helping to make transactions faster and cheaper on Ethereum. However, Arbitrum has managed to stand out from the rest, emerging as a leader in this sector.

Arbitrum, despite being younger than some of the Ethereum Layer-2 blockchains in the market, has been able to snag a significant portion of the market share for itself. According to data from DeFiLlama, the Layer-2 blockchain accounts for approximately 70% of in total value locked (TVL) across all Layer-2 blockchains.
Out of the over $4 billion locked across each of these networks, Arbitrumâ€™s TVL is currently sitting at $2.794 billion. This puts it ahead of its predecessor Polygon, and fierce rival Optimism, both of which have TVL â€¦

entry.title: What Is XRP? The Cryptocurrency Created by Ripple Founders
entry.summary: XRP is a type of cryptocurrency designed to help banks move money more quickly, and cheaply than existing methods. It is largely spearheaded by Ripple.

entry.title: Did XRP Restart Alt Season? Solana, Cardano, Polygon Up Double Digits
entry.summary: Most of the tokens previously deemed securities by the SEC are seeing large gains upon a federal courtâ€™s ruling in the XRP case.

entry.title: Elon Musk Waging â€˜Unlawful Harassment Campaignâ€™ in Dogecoin Lawsuit, Says Attorney
entry.summary: The billionaire's legal team is using a "bottomless war chest" to fund its dirty tactics, the Dogecoin investors' attorney claims.

entry.title: CryptoPunk DJ Seedphrase Signs to WME, Plans to Release Music
entry.summary: Helmet-wearing musician Seedphrase, owner of the rarest CryptoPunks NFT, is also set to launch a new community project.

entry.title: Here Are All the Federal Charges Celsius Founder Mashinsky Faces
entry.summary: The brains behind bankrupt crypto lender Celsius have been hit with a number of serious criminal charges.

entry.title: Judge Rules Ripple Sales of XRP Were Not Securitiesâ€”Except to Institutions
entry.summary: Programmatic sales of XRP made by the company were not illegal, says the court. But Ripple isn't off the hook just yet.

entry.title: XRP Surges 29% on Judge's Ruling in Ripple SEC Case
entry.summary: Is XRP a security? Traders react positively to the latest development in the ongoing SEC case against Ripple over the cryptocurrency.

entry.title: ConsenSys Mesh's TachyonX Fund Wants to Cut the Red Tape for Crypto Founders
entry.summary: TachyonX will offer $150,000 in upfront funding to blockchain startups, along with mentorship from crypto industry heavyweights.

entry.title: You Can Now Pay Merchants on Telegram in Bitcoinâ€”Hereâ€™s How it Works
entry.summary: A new third-party chatbot powered by the TON blockchain allows instant Bitcoin, USDT, and TON payments via Telegram.

entry.title: Former Celsius CEO Alex Mashinsky Arrestedâ€”SEC, CFTC and FTC Sue for Fraud
entry.summary: Celsius and its former CEO have been charged with a host of fresh allegations from four different government agencies Thursday morning.

entry.title: Safe Adds ERC-4337 Compatibility in Account Abstraction Push
entry.summary: ERC-4337 is named simply the "first starting stone" in a wider move towards account abstraction, by Safe co-founder Richard Meissner.

entry.title: DeFi Startup Ondo Expands Yield-Earning Stablecoin Alternative to Polygon
entry.summary: The first company to tokenize U.S. Treasuries wants to expand its market by moving beyond the Ethereum mainnet.

entry.title: Coinbase Cites Supreme Court Student Loans Decision in SEC Legal Battle
entry.summary: The exchange argues that the SEC needed Congressional support before launching its sweeping crackdown on the crypto industry.

entry.title: Gran Saga Unlimited Early Access: Inside the Anime MMORPG on Aptos
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offer her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers
entry.summary: 100 Thieves content creator and gamer Moe also goes by "Yassuo" online after his favorite League of Legends character. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.

entry.title: "Games of the Future Are Going to Be Different," Says Splinterlands Cofounder
entry.summary: Splinterlands Cofounder Matt Rosen tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the game has evolved over its five-year history and why he doesn't listen to the FUD around crypto.

entry.title: Inside Champions Ascension: Like 'For Honor' with NFTs?
entry.summary: Plai Labs Marketing Director Payton Kaleiwahea tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about player response to the combat game Champions Ascension in development, which offers arena combat, raid bosses, AI landscape features, and more.

entry.title: Ex-Activision VP Michael Lee: Gaming Is Crypto's 'Killer App'
entry.summary: Former Activision Vice President Michael Lee is now the SVP of Growth at Matter Labs. At the 3XP gaming conference, Lee sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss crypto gaming and give his predictions for the industry.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes with AMGI Studios and My Pet Hooligan
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes to Burbank, California for a behind-the-scenes tour of AMGI Studios, the developers of upcoming game My Pet Hooligan.

entry.title: Why Legend of Arcardia Chose Sui Over EVM Chains
entry.summary: Legend of Arcadia Executive Producer Andy Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game and why they switched from EVM to new protocol Sui.

entry.title: Rumble Racing Star Game Preview: Is This Mario Kart With NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin shares a first look at Delabs' upcoming lawn mower racing game Rumble Racing Star, which offers a large cast of quirky characters pulled from the worlds of Bored Ape Yacht Club, Pudgy Penguins, and more.

entry.title: Why Laguna Games Turned Down 'Game of Thrones' for Crypto Unicorns
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Laguna Games about why the team chose to move away from an offer with WB Games to develop a Game of Thrones licensed titleâ€”and made Crypto Unicorns instead.

entry.title: Mythical Games CEO John Linden on NFL Rivals Topping 1M Downloads
entry.summary: Mythical Games just raised a $37 million Series C1 round on the back of the early success of NFL Rivals, which has already topped a million downloads in two months. Mythical CEO John Linden joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss the launch and impact of NFL Rivals.

entry.title: How Ava Labs Is Approaching Gaming on Avalanche
entry.summary: At 3XP, Ava Labs Head of Gaming Ed Chang sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss some of the biggest Avalanche-based games on the horizon and how the company is approaching and thinking about Web3 gaming.

entry.title: Ogimi Founder David Gull on Why AI Should Be Your Meditation Coach
entry.summary: Ogimi founder David Gull speaks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about its AI-driven meditation guides and how the technology can enable a more unique, custom-tailored meditation experience for users.

entry.title: VaynerSports Gaming VP Discusses Web3 Content Creators, Decentralized Streaming
entry.summary: Darren Glover, VP of Gaming at talent management agency VaynerSports, sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss the challenges faced by Web3-centric content creators, the current state of the esports market, and how decentralized streaming platforms can challenge centralized leaders like Twitch.

entry.title: NYXL Co-Founder on the State of Esports and Crypto Gaming
entry.summary: Rohit Gupta, co-founder of esports team NYXL, chats with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss challenges faced by the esports industry and opportunities and experiments in Web3.

entry.title: What Is GameBridge? Inside Shrapnel's Gaming Innovation
entry.summary: Marc Mercuri, Head of Platform for Web3 shooter Shrapnel, speaks with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo about GameBridge, a feature that simplifies blockchain item composability and interoperability.

entry.title: Gods Unchained Executive Producer Discusses Epic Games Store Move
entry.summary: Daniel Paez, Executive Producer on Immutable X-based card-battler Gods Unchained, discusses the long-running NFT game's launch on the Epic Games Store and the opportunity it provides.

entry.title: 'Play-to-Earn Is Not Dead. It Will Never Die' Says Words with Friends Creator Paul Bettner
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard Creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on Axie Infinity and Web3 games.

entry.title: Cross the Ages Game Review: A Tough But Rewarding Card Battler
entry.summary: Cross the Ages is a digital collectible card game that challenges players to duel online opponentsâ€”and you can even mint your cards as tradable NFTs. It's complex and difficult to grasp at first, but this mobile-first game has some serious strategic upside. GG contributor Ryan Gladwin puts Cross the Ages through its paces.
